thread.title: Premiere for film marking anniversary of Million Man March
thread.title_full: Premiere for film marking anniversary of Million Man March

title: Premiere for film marking anniversary of Million Man March
text:
0 comments 
A SHORT film marking the 20th anniversary of the Million Man March to Washington DC will receive its premiere in Southampton on Friday. 
The ten minute short film BLACK: A celebration of the 20th Anniversary of The Million Man March was put together as part of Black History Month and will be shown at The Stage Door from 7pm. 
More than 30 black men from the Southampton area formed a choir and assembled in a studio in the city, together with a multi-racial funk band to play live James Brown’s Papa Don’t Take No Mess. Share article 
There will be a small reception followed by music and mingling. 
Freddie & The Freeloaders, featuring Jonathan Fashole-Luke, will be playing at the venue later that evening. Promoted Stories Premiere for film marking anniversary of Million Man March   Keep in touch with local news
